result.execSummary:
The defendant Bernell Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: All court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA.  To be paid by end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Must provide a DNA sample if one has not already been provided, pay associated surcharge.
Court advised defendasnt that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or ammunition.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bernell Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 45 DAYS at the House of Corrections with 3 days credit. Straight time.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 1 YEAR probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
- Complete 120 hours of community service
- Provide a DNA sample unless previously submitted
- Commit no new law violations

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
- All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA)


Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement

Defendant Bernell Johnson in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant sworn in.  
As to Count 1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or ammunition.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Defendant advised that he must provide a DNA sample if one has not already been provided and pay the associated surcharge.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Bernell Johnson in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Michael Thurston appeared via phone for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Branch 25 is in trial and unable to hear this matter. Parties do not object to an adjournment. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Defendant given next court date in person. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Bernell Johnson in court with attorney Alexis Liggins on behalf of Mary Garvin Guimont.  Cynthia M. Davis on behalf of Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set on calendar to address Justice Point violation. Arguments heard from both parties. Court admonished defendant to comply with conditions of Justice Point. Bail remains the same. Case remains scheduled for plea hearing on 5/21/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.
Justice Point violation report - positive drug test - received and filed. Court orderd this matter be set for a hearing. Parties notified. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Bernell Johnson in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Branch 25 is in trial and unable to hear this matter. Parties do not object to an adjournment. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Bernell Johnson in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel has received discovery and an offer from the State and requests a projected plea date. ADA Thurston will be handling this matter for the State. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Bernell Johnson in court with attorney Richard Carpenter for Mary Garvin Guimont.  Ron Dague for Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 4/6/15.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
Court orders defendant to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Bernell Johnson in court with attorney Joan E. Zawikowski.  
Defendant Bernell Johnson in custody.  
William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
